oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Telegram to Roland Hayes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jones, Thomas Elsa (1888-1973); Hayes, Roland (1887-1977)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Musicians
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. Thomas E. Jones wrote to Roland Hayes at Angelmo Farm, in Curryville, Georgia, regarding measurements for a cap and gown, for the "conferring of your degree." "Angel Mo' was what Hayes called his mother, who had been a household slave in Georgia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Fisk University, John Hope and Aurelia E. Franklin Library, Special Collections
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Fisk University, John Hope and Aurelia E. Franklin Library, Special Collections, Thomas E. Jones Collection, Box 51, folder 14
